name: La Quinta Inn & Suites Boone

reviews.text: We have stayed at similar properties in Boone but decided to try something new. We won't be back. Oh, the staff is terrific. Friendly. Smiling. Cheerful greetings. No complaints there. They had nothing to do with the construction of this property. We were on the second/middle floor and felt like we were in a noise sandwich. Loud sounds and noise from both sides, above and outside in the early hours of the morning. Not what was needed on a get away weekend. Also, room has a nice sofa but no side tables. No lamps, not even a floor lamp. And I have to admit I have come to expect flat screen TVs in hotel rooms, not old CRT TVs. Next time we come to Boone, we'll go back to the other property.
reviews.title: Thin walls

reviews.text: Stayed in a King Suite with fireplace and jacuzzi. Nice size room, very comfortable. Room and bathroom clean. Slept very well. Quiet surroundings. Excellent staff, friendly welcome. Only downside is that there is not a mountain view, but I don't think you get that at all with any of the downtown area Boone hotels. Near campus. Short drive to Blowing Rock, about a 20 minute drive to Banner Elk and Sugar Mountain. Went snow tubing and son also went snow boarding.
reviews.title: Comfortable, cozy, clean, & great service

reviews.text: The manager was very understanding about the fact that we had to check out at 5 pm BEFORE the day we'd originally planned to check out, due to possible bad weather the next day in between the hotel and our home destination. Did not expect a partial refund, but he offered one right away. I know a lot of people who have App State students in their families, and I will tell them about our wonderful experience at La Quinta.
reviews.title: Recommended with few cons

reviews.text: We were coming from Miami looking for a different experience in the mountains, country style. La Quinta looks very nice from outside, not the typical "La Quinta Inn" you find everywhere. This one has a "country touch" which was very nice. We stayed in one of their suites, whirlpool and fireplace included. Very nice, spacious, good value, clean. Friendly service at the hotel, great location, close to everything.
reviews.title: Tempur Pedic Beds!
Boone's best kept secret
reviews.text: The most personable staff and well maintained pet friendly hotel in the High Country. A bear to get out of the parking lot going to Boone, but easy access getting in from all directions. Breakfast is excellent, but relegated to coffee, juices and grains. The staff provides excellent instruction and coupons to more hearty fare available in the area. Sleep quality is without peer and includes children and pets freely roaming but quiet and well mannered. I have stayed at numerous locations in Boone and the High Country and recommend La Quinta above all others and especially if you are traveling with children or pets.

As always, the staff at the La Quinta go above and beyond the call of duty to take care of their guests. We love the jacuzzi/fireplace room and the decor of the hotel. One of the only pet friendly places in Boone- and our dogs love it. Great location in the center of town. The only place we stay in Boone.
reviews.title: Another fantastic stay!
Boone getaway
reviews.text: Loved this hotel, had a jaccuzi room w/ fireplace. Room was a nice size (as we travel w/ 2 dogs), very clean, and the staff was very friendly and helpful when we had a problem w/ our phone. Was looked into and fixed within10 minutes! Now that's service! My only complaint is I didn't care for the temperpedic beds, they felt hard to me. Overall stay was great!

We recently stayed at this hotel in Boone. We were glad to find a hotel that was pet friendly in the area. We enjoyed the decor of the hotel which made it feel more like a log cabin than a traditional hotel. I was also impressed by the professionalism and caring attitude of the staff. Our reservations were originally for two days but we had to leave one day early. It was past the time they gave me to cancel the reservation for the next day but they waived the second night fee anyway. This is how to build customer loyalty. You don't expect to find a caring understanding attitude from the staff at this level of a hotel. I have stayed at the Ritz Carlton and some other high end hotels and I found the attitude of the staff on par with these higher end hotels. The only complaints I have are that the television sets are somewhat dated and that the food selection for breakfast was pretty limited compared to other similar hotels.
reviews.title: Caring and Professional Staff

reviews.text: This hotel is in a great location and is one of the nicer LaQuintas I have stayed in. It has a unique early American decor along with the bear and mountain tribute. The rooms were large and well appointed. They appeared to be recently remodeled as well. The breakfast was also quite good and included. I used my loyalty points and found this a great exchange in terms of points for value. The hotel is close to the eclectic downtown which has a college influence and some cool eateries and shops.
reviews.title: Great Location, Cool Decor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in Boone, NC for a weekend vacation. This was my first stay at a La Quinta and was very pleased. Pros: Bed AND Pillows were like nothing I've experienced at other chain hotels. My partner (who brings his own pillows) wanted to take one home! Thankfully, he didn't, but if the hotel reads this, we'd love to know the brand so we can purchase! We did not use the pool or any of the amenities. The breakfast is limited, but we did enjoy coffee, cereal, apples, and oatmeal (pretty much the basics). We still went out for breakfast that morning. Location was easy to find (Corner of 421 and 105). Cons: Parking. The lot is shared with the Sleep Inn and it's challenging to say the least if you arrive at an off time like we did. Also, this is a ski resort town. There will be knicks and scrapes along the walls. We got a great nights rest and will return to this hotel on our next visit.
reviews.title: Perfect Place to Rest

reviews.text: We wanted to come to the mountains for a one-night ski and snow tubing adventure. We booked through hotwire and got a great rate at this hotel. The hotel staff (esp Sarah) was friendly and informative on the phone. We arrived and the hotel was clean and cute. Our room had 2 queen beds and the hotel had the roll away we requested already in the room. The room was modern and we appreciated having a mini fridge. Drawbacks - coffee isn't great, the towels were pretty rough and small and the breakfast is pretty sparse (no fruit, protein or hot items available other than waffles) but the price was right and it met our needs for 1 night. We will return as this is a pet-friendly hotel and we like to travel with our lab.
reviews.title: Cute, clean and nice staff.

reviews.text: Was very pleased when I got there. The lady at the desk let us check in at 10 which is well before the normal 3 pm check in time. The room was spacious and the jacuzzi was nice. Only complaint was the lack of hot water.
reviews.title: Will stay again
love love love the beds
reviews.text: We come to Boone every year for High Country Confrence. This was our 1 st time at this hotel. Check in was good, staff very nice and helpful, room was very nice, but the bed made the stay. One thing that could be better breakfast. We will stay again next year.

reviews.title: Recommend
reviews.text: This is one of the nicest places we have ever stayed. Hope the quailty of the rooms and service stay excellent, and is just not because the place is fairly new. The bed was comfortable and the whole facility was very clean (and smelled it!). Service was great too!

reviews.title: GORGEOUS
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for Valentines day and our anniversary. Which everyday it snowed. Which was very beautiful. We went to beech mount for snowboarding and ice skating. The drive to there from the hotel to a little extra time bc of the heavy snow but it was worth it. The hotel itself was very pretty. The pool just the right tempature. Anything we asked the from desk they took care of ASAP. Break was good at times a little crowded but not to bad. We will diffinitly be back!!

Stayed for one Saturday night in February 2013. Came up from Raleigh to stay in Boone for the weekend and wanted to bring our dog. Found a good AAA rate for $89 for two queen beds and that included our pet staying for free. Hotel is right in the middle of Boone, so close to everything. Hotel felt very new and the fact that it had an indoor pool and hot tub mad it a great place to bring the kids. Beds were tempurpedic memory foam...which was nice. No complaints....we will be back!
reviews.title: Nice hotel with indoor pool and pets stay free!

aka: La Quinta Inn & Suites Boone Hotel Boone
